You are viewing extension docs in chrome via the 'file:' scheme: are you expecting to see local changes when you refresh? You'll need run chrome with --allow-file-access-from-files.
WARNING: This is the BETA documentation. It may not work with the stable release of Chrome.
WARNING: This is unofficial documentation. It may not work with the current release of Chrome.

Description of this parameter from the json schema.
This parameter was added in version . You must omit this parameter in earlier versions, and you may omit it in any version. If you require this parameter, the manifest key minimum_chrome_version can ensure that your extension won't be run in an earlier browser version.

chrome.apiname

Contents

  1. h2Name
    1. h3Name
  2. API reference

For information on how to use experimental APIs, see the chrome.experimental.* APIs page.

Warning: This API is still under development. It is only available for Chrome users on the dev and beta early release channels. dev early release channel. Learn more.

API reference: chrome.apiname

Methods

method name

void chrome.module.methodName(, )

A description from the json schema def of the function goes here.

Parameters

Returns

Callback function

The callback parameter should specify a function that looks like this:

If you specify the callback parameter, it should specify a function that looks like this: 

function(Type param1, Type param2) {...};

This function was added in version . If you require this function, the manifest key minimum_chrome_version can ensure that your extension won't be run in an earlier browser version.
